briefTitle: Comparison of Isovue 370 vs. Standard Protocol in Coronary Computed Tomographic Angiography (CTA)

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* adult patients who are referred for coronary CTA for suspected or known coronary artery disease

Exclusion Criteria:

* creatinine greater than 2.0
* allergy to contrast media
* patients under the age of 18
* women who are pregnant or breast feeding
* patients with cardiac arrhythmia will also be excluded

outcomeMeasures.title: Contrast to Noise Ratio
outcomeMeasures.description: Contrast-to-noise ratios (CNRs) were calculated as follows: CNR = (vascular attenuation - myocardium attenuation) / SD of mean noise attenuation.

outcomeMeasures.title: Image Quality
outcomeMeasures.description: Depiction of Branch Vessels - coronary branch depiction was performed as consensus decisions of two blinded radiologists. Criteria used was abscence or presence of vessels.

outcomeMeasures.title: Motion Artifact
outcomeMeasures.description: The outcome will be measured by individual scores. The scores from multiple readers will be averaged.

outcomeMeasures.title: Attenuation of the Ascending Aorta and Coronary Arteries
outcomeMeasures.description: The investigator will measure the length of visualized coronary artery for the left anterior descending, left circumflex and right coronary arteries as a way of quantifying visualization of distal coronary segments.
